alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 3:11PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Sullivan County through 400 PM EDT... At 310 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Windsor, or 7 miles north of Claremont, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Claremont, Lebanon, Grafton, Enfield, Newport, Grantham, Cornish, Croydon, Sunapee, Plainfield, Springfield and Wilmot. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 37 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central New Hampshire.
